gurmukhi: aUDv jI kubjw so khY inj pRIq lKI Aiq hI qumrI mY ] hau Aiq dIn ADIn AnwQ n bYT skau smuhwie hrI mY ]
transliteration: Oodhar Jikoubjaa So Kahai Nij Preet Lakhiat(i) Hitoumrimai|| Hau At(i) Deen Adheen Anaath Na Baith Sakau Samuhaae Harimai||
translation: Udhava said to Kubja that he had noticed her extremely profound love; he added that he was very lowly and poor and could not sit in front of Lord Krishna;

gurmukhi: kwnH pRqwp qbY auT pIVHy kau dIn auTwiekY vwhI GrI mY ] pY ieqno kr kY BUA bYT rhXo gih pwien nyh CrI mY ]989]
transliteration: Kaahn Prataap Tabai Outh Peehde Kau Deen Outhaae-kai Vaahigharimai|| Pai Itno Kar Kai Bhooaa Baith Rahyo Gadh Paain Neh Chharimai||989||
translation: Feeling glory of Krishna, he put the seat aside and holding the feet of Krishna in his hands with affection, he sat down on the earth.989.

gurmukhi: jy pd pMkj SyS mhyS suryS idnyS inSyS n pwey ] jy pd pMkj byd purwn bKwn pRmwn kY gXwnn gwey ]
transliteration: Je Pad Panndaj Shesh Mahesh Suresh Dinesh Nishesh Na Paae|| Je Pad Panndaj Bed Puraan Bakhaan Pramaan Kai Gyaanan Gade||
translation: The feet, which could not be attained by Sheshanaga, Shiva, the sun and the moon and whose glory has been narrated in Vedas, Puranas etc.;

gurmukhi: jy pd pMkj is`D smwD mY swDq hY mun mon lgwey ] qy pd pMkj kysv ky Ab aUDv lY kr mY shrwey ]990]
transliteration: Je Pad Panndaj Siddh Samaadh Mai Saadhat Hai Mu Mon Lagade|| Te Pad Panndaj Kesav Ke Ab Oodhav Lai Kar Mai Sahraae||990||
translation: Those feet, on which the adepts meditate in their trance, now Udhava is pressing those feet with great affection.990.

gurmukhi: sMq shwrq sXwm ky pwie mhw ibgsXo mn BIqr soaU ] jogn ko joaU DXwn ky bIc n Awvq hY Aiq bXwkl hoaU ]
transliteration: Sant Sahaarat Syaam Ke Paae Mahaa Bigsyo Man Bheethar Sooo|| Jogad Ke Jooo Dhyaan Ke Beech Na Aavat Hai At(i) Byaakal Hooo||
translation: The saints who develop extremely on the spiritual plane, they only endure the Glory of Lord’s feet; those feet, which are not observed in the meditation by the impatient Yogis,

gurmukhi: jw bHmwidk SyS surwidk AMiq n pwvq koaU ] so pd kMjn kI sm qu`il plotq aUDv lY kr doaU ]991]
transliteration: Jaa Brhmaadik Shesh Suraadik Ant(i) Na Paavat Kooo|| So Pad Kanjan Kisam Tull(i) Palotat Oodhav Lai Kar Dooo||991||
translation: And whose mystery has not been understood by Brahma, Indra, Sheshanaga etc., those lotus-feet are now being pressed by Udhava with his hands.991.

gurmukhi: ieiq sXwm plotq aUDv pwie auqY aun mwln swj kIey ] suB b`jRn ky Aru lwl jvwhr dyiK ijsY suK hoq jIey ]
transliteration: It(i) Syaam Palotat Oodhav Paae Outai Oun Maalan Saaj Keee|| Soubh Bajjran Ke Ar(u) Laal Javaahar Dekh(i) Jisai Soukh Hot Jeee||
translation: On this side Udhava is pressing the feet of Krishna, on the other side the female gardener Kubja bedecked herself; she wore the comfort-giving precious stones like rubies, gems etc.,

gurmukhi: ieqny pih kwnH pY Awie geI ibMdrI kih eINgr Bwl dIey ] iqh rUp inhwr hulws bFXo kib sXwm khY jdubIr hIey ]992]
transliteration: Itne Pah(i) Kaahn Pai Aae Gadbindrikah(i) Oongad Dhaal Deee|| Tih Roop Nihaar Hulaas Badhyo Kabi Syaam Kahai Jadoubeer Heee||992||
translation: And applying the mark on the forehead and putting vermilion in the parting of the hair, she went and sat near Krishna; seeing her beauty and elegance, Krishna was very much pleased in his mind.992.

gurmukhi: sj swjn mwln AMgn mY Aiq suMdr so hir pws geI ] mno dUsr cMdklw pRgtI mno hyrq kY ieh rUpseI ]
transliteration: Saj Saajan Maalan Anad Mai At(i) Soundar So Har(i) Paas Gade|| Mano Doosar Channdkalaa Pragadimano Heart Kai Eh Roopmaee||
translation: After bedecking herself, the female gardener Kubja went to Krishna and appeared the second manifestation of Chandarkala;

gurmukhi: hir jU liK kY ijX kI ibrQw kib sXwm khY soaU AYNc leI ] iqh aUpir bYs ASMk BeI mn kI sB SMk prwie geI ]993]
transliteration: Har(i) Joo Lakh(i) Kai Jiya Kibirthaa Dabi Syaam Kahai Sooo Ainch Laee|| Tih Oopar Bais Ashank Bhaiman Kisabh Shank Praae||
translation: Feeling the distress of the mind of Kubja, Krishna pulled her towards himself; Kubja also sitting in the embrace of Krishna abandoned her shyness and all her hesitations ended.993.

gurmukhi: bhIXwN jb hI gih sXwm leI kubjw Aiq hI mn mY suK pwXo ] sXwm imly bhuqy idn mY hm kau kih kY ieh BwNq sunwXo ]
transliteration: Baheeyaan Jab Higadh Syaam Laikoubjaa At(i) Himan Mai Soukh Paayo|| Syaam Mile Bhoute Din Mai Ham Kau Kah(i) Kai Eh Bhaant Sounaayo||
translation: When Krishna caught hold of the arm of Kubja, she felt extreme delight; she said audibly, “O Krishna ! you have met me after many days;
